messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:worldview
messages.msgSnippet: ... Please correct me if I am wrong, but I dont think they measured years the same way we did. There is extreme controversy over how they measured anything
messages.messageBody:
>The Bible is very specific in how many years each person lived. For
>example, "Two years after the flood, when Shem was 100 years old, he
>became the father of Arphaxad. And after he became the father of
>Arphaxad, Shem lived 500 years and had other sons and daughters. When
>Arphaxad had lived 35 years, he became the father of..."
>
>Sheila


Please correct me if I am wrong, but I dont' think they measured years
the same way we did. There is extreme controversy over how they measured
anything (including the measurement of Noah's arc).

kolleen
'still waiting on scientific advancement evidence that animal testing
works'
